intro: Janusia christianeae, commonly known as the Cape Verde morning glory, is a flowering plant native to the Cape Verde Islands. It belongs to the Convolvulaceae family and is characterized by its rapid growth and climbing habit. The plant produces showy, trumpet-shaped flowers that are typically blue or purple in color. It thrives in coastal areas and is adapted to the arid conditions of its native habitat. Due to its ornamental value, it is sometimes cultivated in gardens, though it can be invasive in certain environments.
